alert.note: Alert for Coastal Duval; Coastal Nassau (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued September 27 at 4:05AM EDT until September 29 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. For the Coastal Flood Watch, moderate coastal flooding possible. * WHERE...Southeast Georgia Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, from 8 AM EDT this morning through late Friday night. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from this afternoon through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
